CatDescriptText: Mrs. James Novick, 373 S. Atlantic Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "That's pretty tough to answer. Equal rights is in Constitution, and therefore there should be dependence on that."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. James Novick wearing eyeglasses and textured collared dress with button at neckline and short cuffed sleeves, carrying dark handbag, holding paper bag, standing next to stone block wall with flecked granite wainscot, with store windows and man in background
